result.execSummary:
The defendant Demetrius Earl Walker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

cc: file, defendant, and state.
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Thomas J. McAdams, Br. 7, for review. jbs
Original Transcript PLEA / SENTENCING HEARING  (31 pages) commencing JUNE 19, 2014 received and filed.

Defendant Demetrius Earl Walker in court with attorney Anne A Devitt.  Defendant Demetrius Earl Walker in custody.  Randy P Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Defendant  advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 2 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 YEAR, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 55 days.
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at zero
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 4/19/2016; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 4/19/2016; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Successfully complete an Anger Management Program
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Attorney Anne A Devitt in court, defendant Demetrius Earl Walker not in court, in custody.  Randy P Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defendant was not produced. Case calendared for PLEA and SENTENCING on 6/19/2014 at 1:30 pm in Branch 15.

Defendant Demetrius Earl Walker in court with attorney Anne A Devitt.  Defendant Demetrius Earl Walker in custody.  Marissa Santiago for Randy P Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.    Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Court enters a not guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Original Transcript PRELIMINARY HEARING ADJOURNMENT (6 pages) commencing MAY 12, 2014 received and filed.

Defendant Demetrius Earl Walker in court with attorney Anne A Devitt.  Defendant Demetrius Earl Walker in custody.  Randy P Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
State is requesting an adjournment, officer is not available for today's proceedings.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING AND ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Demetrius Earl Walker in court with attorney Anne A Devitt.  Defendant Demetrius Earl Walker in custody.  Randy P Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WATTS, Branch 15.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.
